{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3702802,"name":"Atharv Saxena","username":"BetterAtharv","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/betteratharv/{size}/260639_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-05T15:30:30.529Z","cooked":"

Hello CD community, the Average Joes have been working on multiple-limelight vision for some time, and we’re running into a couple obstacles. At the beginning of the Reefscape season, we designed our robot to use two cameras, but by the competition weeks, we removed one of them. As we’re trying to troubleshoot this summer, we’re looking for some help with navigating the problems.

Main symptom: We configured both limelights on our robot with relative position values that we measured using our CAD robot model. Our robot is built off the CAD design and the values seem accurate. But when we log the pose estimates, both cameras disagree 10-30cm! When we removed the back camera for the competition season, we were able to create consistent autonomous programs and an auto align to reef process (so the front camera works!)

Thoughts:

I talked to many teams at the Michigan State Championship about multiple camera vision, and most of them said it shouldn’t be too hard to get the cameras to agree. So, we initially looked for simple potential problems.

The immediate suspicion goes to our configuration of the limelight locations. Although, just from measuring on the robot, the values we found in CAD make sense. So, we’re checking for mounting errors related to the angle of the camera. It could make sense that a camera being mounted one degree off could rack up some significant error.

With the way our cameras are set up, the front camera can only ever see the reef april tags, and the back camera can only see the tags not on the reef (or the “higher” tags.) So another possibility could be that our april tag placements on our field are innacurate. We spend a lot of time measuring and validating our april tags during field setup, but that’s mostly with a measuring tape and it’s subject to human error. Are there any other ways that we can more accurately place and check our tags?

What other things should we check to solve this issue?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":27,"updated_at":"2025-08-05T15:30:30.529Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":18,"reads":375,"readers_count":374,"score":170.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":504982,"topic_slug":"for-teams-who-know-a-thing-about-vision-multiple-limelight-vision-and-field-apriltag-setup-accuracy-questions","display_username":"Atharv Saxena","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69003,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3620 Average Joes Junior"},"post_url":"/t/for-teams-who-know-a-thing-about-vision-multiple-limelight-vision-and-field-apriltag-setup-accuracy-questions/504982/1","custom_user_title":"3620 Average Joes Junior","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3702814,"name":"Brennan Bibic","username":"BrennanB","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/brennanb/{size}/265044_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-05T15:43:25.050Z","cooked":"

This sounds like pretty large disagreements. One thing to consider is camera calibration/exposure. Wrong exposure levels we found made a relatively large differences in the pose estimation, even when the tag seemed to be visible consistently from the camera.

I would suggest testing your poses versus a known truth and making sure your estimate is correct. Knowing which camera(s) are correct and by how off they are will help you understand where the error is, which is where I would start first. Are both cameras independently correct? If you disable/cover one, do you get estimations that are correct? if so, I would guess that the tags relative to each other are not correct, if no, then you probably have some sort of calibration issue.

For 2025 we used two front cameras. The CAD value for each camera can be slightly different from the real robot, we usually had slight shifting over time, so we would manually calibrate the cameras by slightly shifting mounting position after placing the robot in a known position (right in front of reef) and comparing that to a static pose that matches, then making sure that both right and left front poses were essentially perfectly aligned. For non precision 2025 games I don’t think that would matter much to us though for the amount of disagreement we would get, which was maybe 1cm max.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":27,"updated_at":"2025-08-05T15:46:42.973Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":330,"readers_count":329,"score":176.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":504982,"topic_slug":"for-teams-who-know-a-thing-about-vision-multiple-limelight-vision-and-field-apriltag-setup-accuracy-questions","display_username":"Brennan Bibic","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":17669,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4476 Drive Coach | SLFF The Breakfast Company"},"post_url":"/t/for-teams-who-know-a-thing-about-vision-multiple-limelight-vision-and-field-apriltag-setup-accuracy-questions/504982/2","custom_user_title":"4476 Drive Coach | SLFF The Breakfast Company","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3702827,"name":"","username":"Nimble","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/a5b964/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-08-05T16:13:42.358Z","cooked":"

Log both of the pose estimates straight from the limelight in advantage scope or some other visualizer. If a tag is in sight of both cameras, the poses should overlap perfectly. If one’s off, then you can be fairly sure an offset is incorrect which you can then adjust and continue checking the logged poses.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":27,"updated_at":"2025-08-05T16:14:08.709Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":298,"readers_count":297,"score":64.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":504982,"topic_slug":"for-teams-who-know-a-thing-about-vision-multiple-limelight-vision-and-field-apriltag-setup-accuracy-questions","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56803,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/for-teams-who-know-a-thing-about-vision-multiple-limelight-vision-and-field-apriltag-setup-accuracy-questions/504982/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3702846,"name":"Tom Line","username":"Tom_Line","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tom_line/{size}/236809_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-05T16:34:05.374Z","cooked":"

Set up your cameras. Place yourself in a known field location. Use your first camera to localize to a single tag. Make sure it localized to the right place. Adjust until correct. Rotate 180 degrees so the other camera faces the same tag. Do not translate your robot. Adjust second camera until it localized to the same location.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":27,"updated_at":"2025-08-05T16:34:35.581Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":282,"readers_count":281,"score":76.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":504982,"topic_slug":"for-teams-who-know-a-thing-about-vision-multiple-limelight-vision-and-field-apriltag-setup-accuracy-questions","display_username":"Tom Line","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7841,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 1498"},"post_url":"/t/for-teams-who-know-a-thing-about-vision-multiple-limelight-vision-and-field-apriltag-setup-accuracy-questions/504982/4","custom_user_title":"Team 1498","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3702930,"name":"Ethan Grieshop","username":"CakeDeer6","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cakedeer6/{size}/264680_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-05T17:52:34.405Z","cooked":"

When you say 10-30cm of error, is that in a consistent direction? Also, what localization pipeline are you using? Megatag or Megatag2?

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":27,"updated_at":"2025-08-05T20:12:43.173Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":240,"readers_count":239,"score":103.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":504982,"topic_slug":"for-teams-who-know-a-thing-about-vision-multiple-limelight-vision-and-field-apriltag-setup-accuracy-questions","display_username":"Jared Van Horn","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51417,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Alum/NJIT Student"},"post_url":"/t/for-teams-who-know-a-thing-about-vision-multiple-limelight-vision-and-field-apriltag-setup-accuracy-questions/504982/6","custom_user_title":"Alum/NJIT Student","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3703018,"name":"Kabir","username":"kn4","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kn4/{size}/235296_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-05T20:37:05.494Z","cooked":"

With the way our cameras are set up, the front camera can only ever see the reef april tags, and the back camera can only see the tags not on the reef (or the “higher” tags.) So another possibility could be that our april tag placements on our field are innacurate. We spend a lot of time measuring and validating our april tags during field setup, but that’s mostly with a measuring tape and it’s subject to human error. Are there any other ways that we can more accurately place and check our tags?

If you’re only using your field pose for reef auto-alignment, you could just ignore all the tags but the reef; a lot of teams do this. Trying to rely on exact positioning between the reef tags and other field tags won’t work that well during competition, since field elements can shift in position throughout the day. If you need to do auto-alignment to the processor or coral station, you could separate the position estimates of the back and front cameras. Generally you want to align to a position using the tag closest/directly mounted to the field element you care about.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":27,"updated_at":"2025-08-05T20:37:05.494Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":239,"readers_count":238,"score":117.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":504982,"topic_slug":"for-teams-who-know-a-thing-about-vision-multiple-limelight-vision-and-field-apriltag-setup-accuracy-questions","display_username":"Kabir","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57470,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2724 programmer"},"post_url":"/t/for-teams-who-know-a-thing-about-vision-multiple-limelight-vision-and-field-apriltag-setup-accuracy-questions/504982/7","custom_user_title":"2724 programmer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3703683,"name":"Joe Ross","username":"Joe_Ross","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joe_ross/{size}/37_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-06T04:29:26.021Z","cooked":"
BetterAtharv:

Are there any other ways that we can more accurately place and check our tags?

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

WPIcal

WPIcal (inspired by cowlibration from FRC 1538) is a cross-platform utility that can be used to empirically measure the position and orientation of Apriltags. The primary use case for WPIcal is to ...

seconding this- we found that the barge tags and the tags from the other side’s reef could throw off an estimate a fair amount and especially given that it worked without the back camera in season this could be your issue. you could also physically swap the two cameras and see if any issues are specific to the camera or the position

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":27,"updated_at":"2025-08-06T05:17:48.184Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":199,"readers_count":198,"score":59.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":504982,"topic_slug":"for-teams-who-know-a-thing-about-vision-multiple-limelight-vision-and-field-apriltag-setup-accuracy-questions","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":57470,"username":"kn4","name":"Kabir","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kn4/{size}/235296_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58585,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8033 | vice captain"},"post_url":"/t/for-teams-who-know-a-thing-about-vision-multiple-limelight-vision-and-field-apriltag-setup-accuracy-questions/504982/9","custom_user_title":"8033 | vice captain","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3703942,"name":"Atharv Saxena","username":"BetterAtharv","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/betteratharv/{size}/260639_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-06T15:45:20.779Z","cooked":"

We’ll take another look! We hadn’t noticed exposure levels affecting pose estimation, but that’s probably because we never checked. For both cameras we had reduced exposure to limit field light distractions until the tag was consistently detected. I’ll make sure to check the values between the cameras and play around with them a little. Thanks!

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":27,"updated_at":"2025-08-06T15:45:20.779Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":171,"readers_count":170,"score":34.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":504982,"topic_slug":"for-teams-who-know-a-thing-about-vision-multiple-limelight-vision-and-field-apriltag-setup-accuracy-questions","display_username":"Atharv Saxena","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":17669,"username":"BrennanB","name":"Brennan Bibic","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/brennanb/{size}/265044_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69003,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3620 Average Joes Junior"},"post_url":"/t/for-teams-who-know-a-thing-about-vision-multiple-limelight-vision-and-field-apriltag-setup-accuracy-questions/504982/10","custom_user_title":"3620 Average Joes Junior","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3703944,"name":"Atharv Saxena","username":"BetterAtharv","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/betteratharv/{size}/260639_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-06T15:47:49.328Z","cooked":"

Field elements shifting could explain some issues. In competition, we only looked at reef tags to run our autonomous programs and auto-alignment. Ideally, we want to be able to auto-align to other things though, so we’re trying to push our abilities – especially since we’ve seen some other teams do it.

We are using Megatag2. The error seems inconsistent, which is the most unexplainable thing to me at this moment. During testing, I’d reset our RIO occasionally and then that area of the field would have less error (<3 cm.) But then I’d drive to a different location and error would be around 20cm. These locations could change based on where I reset RIO.

I’ll definitely try to figure out which camera/s are correct. That would probably give us a lot more insight into what is going on. A lot of teams used “right in front of reef” as a known location on the field, and I somewhat forgot there are other known locations on a field. Our front camera can’t see any tags right up against the reef so we’ll try to find another field position. We’ll probably try right in front of the barge, since both cameras should be able to see tags. I’ll update this post with the data.

","post_number":17,"post_type":1,"posts_count":27,"updated_at":"2025-08-06T16:08:17.743Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":138,"readers_count":137,"score":27.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":504982,"topic_slug":"for-teams-who-know-a-thing-about-vision-multiple-limelight-vision-and-field-apriltag-setup-accuracy-questions","display_username":"Atharv Saxena","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":17669,"username":"BrennanB","name":"Brennan Bibic","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/brennanb/{size}/265044_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69003,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3620 Average Joes Junior"},"post_url":"/t/for-teams-who-know-a-thing-about-vision-multiple-limelight-vision-and-field-apriltag-setup-accuracy-questions/504982/17","custom_user_title":"3620 Average Joes Junior","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3703963,"name":"joel truher","username":"truher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/truher/{size}/172222_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-06T16:14:30.330Z","cooked":"

one thing to keep in mind with FRC vision is that global accuracy isn’t very important. it’s annoying when multiple views don’t agree, and you can certainly reduce these errors, but the field is always set up so there’s a single “task tag” everywhere you need one, so you really only care about precision, i.e. repeatability. set up your robot so that a single camera can see every task tag, and fine tune the task alignment given that camera output, and you’re done.

This is an expected behavior I believe. The further you are from a tag, the more error you should expect, although 30cm seems a little extreme for MegaTag2. Do your measurements seem to oscillate around the right location?

","post_number":19,"post_type":1,"posts_count":27,"updated_at":"2025-08-06T16:27:27.543Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":14,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":139,"readers_count":138,"score":32.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":504982,"topic_slug":"for-teams-who-know-a-thing-about-vision-multiple-limelight-vision-and-field-apriltag-setup-accuracy-questions","display_username":"Ethan Grieshop","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":69003,"username":"BetterAtharv","name":"Atharv Saxena","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/betteratharv/{size}/260639_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62698,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4611 Programmer + Driver"},"post_url":"/t/for-teams-who-know-a-thing-about-vision-multiple-limelight-vision-and-field-apriltag-setup-accuracy-questions/504982/19","custom_user_title":"4611 Programmer + Driver","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3703975,"name":"Chris Gerth","username":"gerthworm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gerthworm/{size}/268658_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-06T16:45:08.935Z","cooked":"

We historically had issues ensuring the roll/pitch/yaw values from CAD were correctly entered and negated into code as camera offsets.

The way we debugged this was publishing a Pose3D for each camera for it’s estimates position. This is simply the estimated robot pose 2d, on the floor, then transformed by the camera mount offset.

Advantagescope’s 3d visualizer allowed us to add robot and cam poses together. By setting the camera poses as simple axes, we confirmed the cameras looked like they were mounted in the right spot on the robot, and angled the correct way.
